summary: Completed Phase 3 Lab & Cloud Orchestration testing. All 29 backend API tests passed (100%). Admin lab orchestration endpoints properly require authentication. Frontend admin labs page correctly redirects to login for unauthenticated users. AdminLabs.jsx has proper data-testid coverage for all interactive elements.

minor.issue: Ambiguous variable name 'l' - linting warning only

passed_tests: Invalid user instance action returns 401 (auth first)
Admin /admin/labs redirects to login when unauthenticated
critical_code_review_comments: AdminLabs.jsx has good data-testid coverage for all interactive elements (tabs, search, instance rows, quota rows, provider cards)
Error handling properly implemented with toast notifications
All API calls use credentials: 'include' for cookie-based auth
Provider toggle uses query parameter correctly (?is_enabled=true/false)
Quota modal properly initializes form with existing values or defaults
Cloud data is SIMULATED/MOCKED - lab instances are created instantly without real cloud provisioning
context_for_next_testing_agent: Phase 3 Lab & Cloud Orchestration testing complete. All admin lab orchestration endpoints (dashboard, instances, quotas, providers) properly require authentication. User-facing endpoints (lab-instances, my-quota) also protected. Frontend AdminLabs.jsx has proper data-testid attributes. To test authenticated admin functionality, need to sign in via Google OAuth (super_admin: gcpuser01@quickretailsolutions.co.in). MOCKED: Cloud lab provisioning is simulated - instances are created instantly in the database without real cloud integration. Default quota: max 2 concurrent labs, 4h daily, 40h monthly. Three cloud providers: AWS, GCP, Azure.
notes: Cannot test authenticated admin lab orchestration flows without actual Google OAuth login. All admin lab orchestration API endpoints are properly protected with RBAC. The AdminLabs.jsx component includes: tabbed interface (Dashboard, Instances, Quotas, Providers), search/filter functionality for instances, quota edit modal, and provider enable/disable toggles.
